data.title: Rate Limiting on  https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Microsoft/vscode/0.10.8/src/vs/vscode.d.ts
data.body:
GitHub is rate limiting access to vscode.d.ts file. As a result, AppVeyor builds are failing as AppVeyor recycles across 6 IP address (https://www.appveyor.com/docs/build-configuration#ip-addresses) 

As per GitHub documentation (https://developer.github.com/v3/#rate-limiting):

> For unauthenticated requests, the rate limit allows you to make up to 60 requests per hour.

Detailed Build Output: 

https://ci.appveyor.com/project/jpoon/vim/build/1.0.80.

> vim@0.0.11 postinstall C:\projects\vim
> node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/install && gulp init
> 
> Detected VS Code engine version: ^0.10.8
> Error installing vscode.d.ts: Error: Expected an array of tags, but received: {"message":"API rate limit exceeded for 104.197.145.181. (But here's the good news: Authenticated requests get a higher rate limit. Check out the documentation for more details.)","documentation_url":"https://developer.github.com/v3/#rate-limiting"}
> 
> npm ERR! Windows_NT 6.3.9600
> npm ERR! argv "C:\Program Files (x86)\nodejs\\node.exe" "C:\Program Files (x8
> 
> https://ci.appveyor.com/project/jpoon/vim/build/1.0.80

Suggestion:
- put this file behind a proxy or
- add it so typings registry (https://github.com/typings/registry)

data.title: Give us a way to start or restart OmniSharp
data.body:
Hello everyone,

OmniSharp some times decides to play hard to get with me while working with ASP.Net Core projects :| I don't know how to reproduce it or why it happens, but it just does. The result is "OmniSharp server is not running." message.

Most of the times, fixing it means I need to make "dummy" modification to project.json file and hope that this triggers starting or restarting OmniSharp.

data.title: Ctrl+Hover blocks e.g. Copy/Cut/Paste etc.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When a function call or symbol is defined in two different files, the quick open box pops up with different suggestions, effectively blocking all keyboard shortcuts outside of it's scope.

E.g. 
1. Double click on a symbol to highlight it
2. Keep the mouse still hovering
3. Press Ctrl in order to sequence Ctrl+C

The quick open box then pops up and you are unable to perform your copy.

data.title: Prompt to review license terms
data.body:
The license terms for VS Code will change slightly for March, we will remove the expiration for example. As a result, we need to let people who are automatically upgraded know and give them an opportunity to view the license.

Only if the user is being automatically updated, prompt on startup that says

"Our license terms have changed, please click 'View License' to see the updated version."

With two options "View License" and "Close"

"View License" should use the FW Link from the Help | View License menu (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=533485)

data.title: VSCode walks all files under project, even excluded directories
data.body:
VS Code currently walks all everything under the project's directory, even excluded files.
1. Go to some project folder
2. Create a big directory hierarchy in a subfolder. `git clone https://github.com/torvalds/linux.git` will do it.
3. Launch VSCode and open the project folder
4. Using `fs_usage` or equivalent tool, notice that VS Code is walking that hierarchy and stat'ing all files in it
5. Try to add a setting to exclude the file:
   
   ```
       "files.exclude": {
           "linux/": true
       }
   ```
6. Repeat step 3 and 4. Notice that the linux directory no longer appears in the sidebar, but VS Code still walks the directory and stats everything.

In my case I have a few million files, and this directory traversal is a serious slowdown.

VS Code Version 0.10.9 (0.10.9) 45d69357c9eb068dd8e624f5b0fe461cd2078d88, OS X 10.11.3

data.title: Breakpoints and variables/watch not matching up with code when running mocha with babel6
data.body:
I have a few mocha tests that need to exercise some ES6 code which is normally targeted for the browser. I'm using babel through webpack to manage packaging this up on the fly using [webpack-dev-server](https://webpack.github.io/docs/webpack-dev-server.html). In order to support running the tests in node I've opted to use the `--compilers js:babel-core/register` option with mocha to allow dynamic compiling of the ES5 tests and their imports. I've followed advice given for other related issues by trying to precompile the source, ensuring I have source maps enabled, and setting `outDir` as needed in the `launch.json` file but I'm still not getting good results. I've also made sure that my [path doesn't contain any spaces](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3667). I've also tried various forms source maps (inline, both, true, ...). Eventually when letting the test run through an error is hit but error shows is a line that appears to be the transpiled code as opposed to the original source.

My launch configuration:

``` json
{
    "name": "Test",
    "type": "node",
    "request": "launch",
    "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/mocha/bin/_mocha",
    "stopOnEntry": false,
    "args": ["./test/**/*.js", "--compilers", "js:babel-core/register", "--require", "babel-polyfill"],
    "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
    "runtimeExecutable": null,
    "runtimeArgs": [
        "--nolazy"
    ],
    "env": {
        "NODE_ENV": "development"
    },
    "externalConsole": false,
    "sourceMaps": true,
    "outDir": "${workspaceRoot}/lib"
}
```

Possibly related issues:
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3144
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3667
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2963
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1552

data.title: Hover message/tooltip on ruler when defining decorators

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Is there a way to define message/tooltip to be displayed in the `overviewRuler` that is defined when you create a decorator (`createTextEditorDecorationType`)?

I found a way to display a `hoverMessage` when you add the decorator itself (`TextEditor.setDecorations`), but the message is displayed at the left side (between the gutter and the text), not in the ruler.

This could be an easy way to get information from other places of the document, without scrolling the file. Just move the mouse over the ruler and get the information. Maybe even becoming a _magnifying glass_ :smile: 

Thanks in advance

data.body: Adding [Ionic framework](http://ionicframework.com/docs/api/) directives to the HTML Intellisense

data.title: [Extension API] Keybindings for caplocks
data.body:
Related: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3223, https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/issues/157

How can an extension distinguish between `a` and `a`+`capslock`?

In both cases, the extension sees `a` as being pressed. With the `capslock` keybinding we can tell if the key was pressed, but there's no way to determine if capslock is currently ON vs OFF.

data.title: Vote on Stack Overflow for `visual-studio-code` to be a synonym of `vscode`
data.body:
At the moment lots of questions are posted under the tag [`vscode`](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode) and [`visual-studio-code`](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/visual-studio-code). It would be great, if  `visual-studio-code` would become a synonym for `vscode`. 

Therefore, if you have more than 2500 reputation points and an answer score of 5 please vote here: [stackoverflow.com/tags/vscode/synonyms](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/vscode/synonyms)

data.title: Triple click should include newline
data.body:
VSCode uses non-standard behavior for triple-clicking from every other text editor on the market (including Visual Studio):

When triple-clicking on a line of code, the entire line should be selected, **including the newline**. VSCode skips the newline in its selection.

data.title: Use local version of gulp in ./scripts/code.sh
data.body:
As with #3649 it removes the need for global installation of gulp. This was already the case for the windows, in ./scripts/code.bat.

This made me able to build and run a dev version of VS Code without gulp globally :dancers:

data.title: Make high-contrast mode less hacky for Monaco editor in IE and Edge
data.body:
In our **high contrast theme** we are using clever CSS that sidesteps around style overrides IE and Edge do when Windows is in High Contrast Mode.

Fortunately, there's a single rule we can use in CSS now to stop IE 10+ and Edge from trying to modify our styles.

`-ms-high-contrast-adjust: none`

It overrides the browsers' default behavior to modify the styles to be more high-contrasty.  This means we can stop using hacks like `::after` and `::before`  elements to insert icons as non-background images (which would otherwise not be displayed as background images).

We need to test that this works well in Monaco and decide if we are ok only supporting IE 10+ as far as IE goes.

Provided we're all good, then let's replace all the hacks with natural solutions.

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh771863(v=vs.85).aspx

data.title: [CSharp] Have "add using ..." on top in quick fix dialog
data.body:
Have "add using ..." on top in quick fix dialog

This is a real timesaver as the suggestion is 99% of the time correct but it's at the bottom, requiring an extra "arrow key up" keystroke to complete the action.

It is a bit of a flow killer

data.title: Update incremental build instructions in wiki
data.body:
As https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/3649 got merged, the incremental build instructions in [wiki/How-to-Contribute](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#incremental-build) should be updated to:

``` bash
npm run watch
```

as global install of `gulp` on the developer's machine is no longer required.

data.title: Added telemetry for debugging scenarios
data.body:
Added watchExpressionCount to debugSessionStart and debugSessionStop
Added an event for when a user is entering commands in Debug Console
Added events for users clicking on items in CallStack and Variables windows during debugging

data.title: Expect Shift+END to select to end of line
data.body: With cursor in the middle of a line, when I press Shift + End, I expect the selection to extend to the end of line.   Current behavior seems to just move the cursor to the end of line.

data.title: Backspace must decrease indent (as Shift-Tab do) when the line is empty
data.body:
e.g. for this code

``` C
    if (cond) {
        return ;
        |
```

where | is the cursor position. By pressing backspace the cursor must be aligned with "if".

data.title: Support for homebrew
data.body: Support for distribution via http://caskroom.io/ would be great. Homebrew / cask is the defacto standard for software delivery for Mac developers.

data.title: Extensions should be able to contribute file templates via a new UI feature - New File Template ...
data.body:
Our extension has several file types that we would like to provide users with a "starting" set of boilerplate code.  I would envision a new menu entry in the navigator under `New File` called perhaps `New File Template...` that would pop up a UI that lists extensions that contribute file templates.  The user selects the extension they're interested in, and then they see the file templates for that extension.  For PowerShell we would like to provide the following file templates:
- Module manifest file (.psd1)
- PowerShell Gallery Publish PSake script (.ps1)
- Fileshare Publish PSake script (.ps1)
- PowerShell Build, Test and Publish tasks (tasks.json)

The user selects one, presses OK/Close and that file gets placed into their workspace.

data.title: Git: sometimes "Open File" and "Open Change" show up disabled in context menu
data.body:
@joaomoreno I wonder if this is a regression from my change to make the context menu show up after process.nextTick()? Sometimes I see "Open File" and "Open Change" disabled when I right click on an outgoing change.

Maybe you could check out if the code is sensitive to the context menu not opening sync anymore?
